data.text:
@kyle_lappin_335 @EWoodhouse7 My bad - so starting from beginning of 2021 this is what it would have looked like:
Jan1-Jan23 - masks (2020 holiday wave)
Jan23-Nov27 - no masks
Nov27-Feb5 - masks (Omicron)
Feb5-present - no masks

This is more reasonable and aligned with risk than what came before.

@EWoodhouse7 Guidelines recommend masking whenever cases are more than 200 cases per wk per 100,000 & more than 10 admissions per wk per 100,000. Seems easy to hit multiple times a year. Will JB and Mayor follow?
@EWoodhouse7 I'll be passing through Kenosha and Racine Counties tonight.  Should I mask up while in these high transmission areas?
@EWoodhouse7 How does this change Lightfoot’s rules about all the states being orange and quarantining when you return to Chicago? 🤣
@EWoodhouse7 JUST SAY NO!! DAMMIT PEOPLE, TELL THE GOVERNMENT TO FUCK OFF! THAT IS ONE OF THE PRIVELEGES OF BEING A US CITIZEN!

@EWoodhouse7 This is a problem. Total set up for perpetual seasonal masking and boosters but it’s shrouded in the near term joy of “giving people a break.”  Pritzker’s “masks work” looms ominously on the horizon.

CORRECTION: These aren't transmission rates, but the CDC's new "Community Levels and Indicators" - a new rubric that still fails to be honest about what a COVID-19 admission/patient is -- and that will no doubt be used by Gov's like mine to establish on/off switch masking. https://t.co/Lo1fsU1Efy
@EWoodhouse7 Those lines are actually where those acrylic panels have been strategically placed.

@bidens_diaper @EWoodhouse7 Exactly what I thought….my county in MI and the one next two us are still ‘high’ but we have crappy small hospitals.  New metric makes our 2 counties in SW MI look BAD and scary! -Bet that won’t stop all the Chicagoans stop coming to their lake houses here.
